title: Business Analyst Intern
requirements:
Granite Partners is currently seeking outstanding candidates to join the Granite Business Analyst Program as interns this summer. Analyst interns in the program will get broad exposure and learn what it’s like to work for a mission-driven private investment and holding company.

Over the summer internship, you will gain experience in data analysis and data visualization, general and market research, strategy and operations, and digital transformation as you help us grow the Minnesota-based Granite Companies. At the end of the summer, if you meet performance expectations, you will receive an offer to return full-time as a Business Analyst upon graduation. Returning analysts may also continue to work at Granite Partners part-time during their final academic year.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
As a Business Analyst Intern, you will join Granite Partners for a 10-week period, during which you will receive training, professional development, and direct 1:1 mentorship from an Executive in the firm. In this role, you will get the opportunity to work with a variety of stakeholders in the Granite community to solve challenging problems. You will be expected to own a project from start to finish.

TRAINING
Build models and dashboards like an investor – complete financial modeling training and build a model and or dashboard from start to finish (including data gathering, input, cleaning, and structuring) leveraging systems tools like Domo 
Solve problems like a consultant – learn to structure and break down problems, manage a project plan, research and synthesize data, and translate meaningful insights into actionable recommendations 
Communicate and present a recommendation like an executive – develop and prepare a compelling presentation that you will get a chance to share directly with Granite Leaders
Think like an owner – learn to make decisions with a long-term vision and 100-year sustainability objective

COACHING & MENTORSHIP
Each intern will receive weekly personalized coaching from an assigned mentor at Granite Partners who will help ensure you are acquiring skills, developing relationships, and growing as a future business leader, while getting the support and tools that you need to complete your project
Each intern will also be paired with a “Executive Champion” who will act as a guide for your personal development throughout the summer

EXPERIENCE THE GRANITE COMMUNITY
Understand how Granite Partners approaches valuation and seeks to create value for all stakeholders
Participate in Granite Affinity Group meetings and experience collaboration among leaders across the Granite Companies
Gain exposure to the digital strategy and transformation project taking place throughout the Granite Companies
Spend time with other Granite Company interns at Granite Intern Day – a day of connecting, networking, building relationships, and attending the Franklin Covey “7 Habits for Highly Effective Leaders” forum
Participate in a range of social activities to get to know the firm and have fun in St. Cloud and the Twin Cities

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

A successful Business Analyst Intern at Granite Partners will:
Be in the junior year of an undergraduate degree with an expected graduation date of December 2021 or May 2022
Have outstanding academic performance and a demonstrated record of achievement
Have summer, student, or full-time work experience, along with community engagement and service, extra-curricular activities, sports achievements, student club leadership, academic honors, artistic works, etc.
Be a self-starter, a problem-solver, and a critical thinker who is detail-oriented and results-driven
Be able to conduct primary (i.e., interviews, surveys) and secondary (i.e., analyst reports and web) research with strong organizational skills to manage the research project
Have a passion for analyzing data and creating meaningful insights; analytical tools experience (Excel, Domo) preferred 
Be humble and have excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability and character to establish and maintain working relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders and colleagues at all levels
Thrive in a small, agile, and entrepreneurial team working across a range of responsibilities and assignments simultaneously 
Be a servant leader who is caring, supportive, and anticipates the needs of other team members; be willing to “roll up your sleeves” and help wherever needed
Have a zeal for broad learning and continuous improvement; be gritty and resilient
Be aligned with our mission to grow stakeholder value and our vision of enabling world-class wellbeing; live the values of the Granite community 
Have a passion for the five holistic dimensions of wellbeing: career, social, financial, physical, and community

LOCATION
While schedules will vary, we anticipate onsite time in our St. Louis Park and St. Cloud offices (contingent on COVID-19 safety considerations) for effective relationship development, planning, coordination, communicating, and team meetings. Working virtually from a home office will also occur as we continue to transition from work-from-home.

title: Algo Internship - Summer 2022
requirements:
We are currently accepting applications for Summer 2022 internships, and we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis starting in late Spring 2021!

HRT is seeking exceptional, full-time students across all degree levels to join our Algo summer internship program. Algo developers at HRT focus on research and implementation of automated trading strategies. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to rotate with our high-frequency trading, multi-frequency trading, and/or machine learning teams. In close collaboration with your mentors, you will apply sophisticated quantitative modeling techniques to understand and predict market behavior and write software to improve our trading strategies.

We are looking for quantitatively-driven and practically-minded programmers, scientists, and mathematicians who want to work on the most challenging problems in our field, enjoy collaboration, and hate the idea of climbing corporate ladders.

What To Expect
A fast-paced summer training program to give you an introduction to the quantitative trading industry. You will have the opportunity to get exposure to our high-frequency trading, multi-frequency trading, and/or machine learning teams.
Leverage our proprietary infrastructure (Python/C++) in conjunction with third-party tools to conduct quantitative research and data analysis.
Use machine learning and time series techniques to derive novel insights regarding market behavior from large and complex datasets.
Work on real projects in close collaboration with experienced researchers, traders, and developers.
Use our world class compute cluster to run simulations and crunch data
Build predictive models for financial markets using a combination of market and non-market data.
Participate in seminars that will give you an overview of markets and HRT’s trading philosophy.
Enjoy a curriculum of talks, trading games, mentorships, and social events throughout the summer.


Requirements
You are a full-time undergraduate, masters, or PhD student in a quantitative discipline (e.g. math, physics, computer science, statistics, or a related program)
You will be graduating and looking for full-time roles in 2023.
Experience programming in Python is a must; C++ is a plus for those interested in high-frequency trading.
You have experience with statistical analysis, numerical programming, or machine learning in Python, R, or MATLAB.
A passion for applying quantitative models and technology toward solving real-world problems.
Strong communication skills.

CULTURE

Hudson River Trading (HRT) brings a scientific approach to trading financial products. We have built one of the world's most sophisticated computing environments for research and development. Our researchers are at the forefront of innovation in the world of algorithmic trading.

At HRT we come from all sorts of backgrounds: mathematics, computer science, statistics, physics, and engineering. We’re a community of self-starters who are motivated by the excitement of being at the cutting edge of automated trading. Our culture celebrates great ideas whether they come from HRT veterans or new hires. At HRT we’re friends and colleagues, whether we are sharing a meal, playing the latest board game, or writing elegant code. We embrace a culture of togetherness that extends far beyond the walls of our office.

Seem like something you might be interested in? Our goal is to find the best people and bring them together to do great work in a place where everyone is valued. HRT is proud of our diverse staff; we have offices all over the globe and benefit from our varied and unique perspectives. HRT is an equal opportunity employer; so whoever you are, we’d love to get to know you.

title: Center for the Future of Aging: Intern
requirements:
The Milken Institute is a nonprofit, nonpartisan think tank that helps people build meaningful lives, in which they can experience health and well-being, pursue effective education and gainful employment, and access the resources required to create ever-expanding opportunities for themselves and their broader communities.

A center of the Milken Institute, the Center for the Future of Aging elevates awareness, advances solutions, and catalyzes action to promote healthy longevity and financial wellness. Through research, convening, advocacy, and partnership with leaders across key sectors, the Center works to improve lives and build a better future for all ages.

The Opportunity

The intern would have the opportunity to become actively involved in the Center for the Future of Aging’s mission-driven work and ambitious program initiatives. This internship is a paid part-time opportunity (projected 20 hours a week), and will report to the Director, with an opportunity to work with the Senior Director and Chairman and to interact with external CFA stakeholders. Research, convening, and communications are core elements in the Center’s plan to drive change. The right candidate will be well organized, a strong writer, a relationship builder, creative, and willing to tackle tasks from the highest concept to the smallest detail.

Responsibilities
Communications and Coordination: Supports the Center’s Advisory Board, which includes prominent leaders from business, philanthropy, policy, and academia, through preparation for quarterly meetings, media monitoring, member engagement, logistics management, and record keeping.
Research and Writing: Provides research and writing support for reports, presentations, articles, and digital content, drawing from scholarly sources and organizing relevant information into literature reviews and outlines.
Outreach and Administration: Assists with relationship development and participates in overall administration by using SalesForce and Excel to track key business metrics.
Events and Programming: Helps with the development of engagement strategies for initiatives and execution of high-level events, including logistics, materials, and external communications for conferences, summits and roundtables.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s and PhD candidates encouraged; emphasis in health, aging, policy, or communications.
Minimum of one year of experience in a sophisticated nonprofit, corporate, government, professional services, or academic institution preferred.
Experience in research, writing for multiple audiences, and high-level content creation.
Experience with project management, administration, and communicating with VIPs.
Expert user in Microsoft 365 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).

Personal Qualifications
Exceptional oral and written communication abilities.
Excellent organizational and planning skills.
Deep interest in changing the culture of aging. Appreciation of the range of issues involved.
Intellectual curiosity. Engaged listener and learner.
Commitment to excellence and a strong work ethic.
The attitude of “no job is too small” and attention to detail that ensures outstanding results.
Note: Temporarily, due to COVID-19 this position is currently working remotely and any applicant should plan to return to the office in the future.

We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas at this time. Being authorized to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment.

With our offices in Santa Monica, Washington DC, and New York City, MI is proud to employ incredible people across the country. Right now, we are eligible to hire in CA, CT, DC, MA, MD, MO, NJ, NY, OR, and VA. Any candidate must reside in one of these jurisdictions prior to onboarding.

title: Summer Intern
requirements:
FINANCIAL ANALYST SUMMER INTERN
Delphos International
Locations: Washington, D.C. or Eastern Time Zone
 ABOUT DELPHOS INTERNATIONAL:
Delphos International is a premier independent financial advisory firm specializing in raising long-term, competitively-priced capital for businesses in emerging markets. Founded in 1987, we have arranged over $20 billion in development finance (equity, grants, loans, loan guarantees, and insurance) to support the efforts of over 1,200 companies. We specialize in tapping into the resources of more than 350 government agencies and multilateral organizations worldwide to help clients realize their international business goals and have sustainable impact. In addition to our capital raising efforts, Delphos International has broad experience providing financial advisory services to government and private sector clients across multiple industries, including power, telecoms, agriculture, social infrastructure, real estate, and financial services, among others. Our geographic scope covers emerging and frontier markets globally, including Africa, Asia, Latin America, the Middle East, and Eastern Europe.
 For more details, visit www.delphosinternational.com .
 ROLE OVERVIEW:
Delphos International is seeking Financial Analyst Interns for the Summer of 2021. The ideal candidate would be a current undergraduate (preferably sophomore and up) or graduate-level student, preferably pursuing a degree in business administration, finance, accounting, economics, or a similar field of study, with a background and interest in international business, finance, and infrastructure/energy. Candidates should have a good understanding of financial statements, strong writing and research skills, and solid financial modelling/MS Excel skills. The internship period is from May to August, with some flexibility regarding the starting and ending dates. The internship is full-time.
 Interns provide assistance to the firm’s staff across all levels, including the most senior team members. Full-time staff rely heavily on interns to complete substantive work and be trusted members of the project team. Historically, Delphos has often hired from the intern pool. Therefore, successful interns could potentially transition to a full-time position.
 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Summer intern responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
Conducting economic, market, and other related research.
Assisting staff throughout the project cycle (initial information gathering, producing a project information memorandum, financial modeling and valuation, facilitating due diligence requests, etc.).
Monitoring databases for relevant Request for Proposals.
Assisting with client proposals.
Performing other administrative and clerical duties.
Other miscellaneous duties as requested by full-time staff.
 REQUIREMENTS:
·       Education: Current undergraduate (at least beyond sophomore year) or graduate student with a focus in business administration, international affairs, finance, economics, etc.
·       Required Qualifications include, but are not limited to, the following:
Strong interest in international business, finance, and infrastructure/ energy.
Good understanding of financial statements.
Basic understanding of project finance.
Strong technical writing, research, and editing skills.
Solid financial modelling skills.
MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint expertise.
Strong organizational management skills and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment and under tight deadlines.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and fluency in English.
 POSITION DETAILS:
·       Compensation: This is a paid internship. Hourly rates will be determined based on the candidate’s experience and qualifications.
·       Opportunities: There is potential for successful summer interns to transition to a full time position.
·       Location: While the main office supporting summer interns is located in Washington, D.C., summer interns will be expected to work remotely until further notice.
 TO APPLY:
Interested candidates should email their resume and cover letter to hiring@delphosinternational.com.  Cover letters should include the following: (1) available start date, (2) US work authorization, (3) confirmation of availability to work full-time and for at least ten weeks during the summer term, and (4) two professional references whom we may contact.
 If extended an offer, the candidate will be required to pass a background check and a drug test.
 STATEMENT OF NON-DISCRIMINATION: Delphos International is strongly committed to hiring a diverse and multicultural staff. Delphos International does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, or ethnicity.

title: UTSI Summer Research Intern Program 2021
requirements:
UNIVERSITY OF TENNESSEE SPACE INSTITUTE (UTSI)

2021 SUMMER RESEARCH INTERN PROGRAM

JOB DESCRIPTION: The Summer Research Intern Program at UTSI in Tullahoma, Tennessee provides undergraduate students with research experiences. Interns are assigned to the supervision of one or more UTSI professors and given a long-term research project to complete over the course of the summer. At the end of their appointment, interns summarize their research in individual final reports and discuss their findings in short presentations. Some travel may be required.Additional educational opportunities are provided, including engineering seminars and a career panel discussion.Due to COVID-19 developments, the program is subject to change.

Employment Details

9 Week Summer Internship

Application Deadline: Friday, March 5, 2021

Position Type:Temporary, Part-time (75%)

Salary: Total of $4,050 stipend ($15.00/hr x 30 hrs/wk x 9 wks)

Location: UTSI campus in Tullahoma, Tennessee

Starts On: June 7, 2021

Ends On: August 6, 2021

Travel: Some travel to other facilities may be required.

HOUSING INFORMATION: A limited amount of on-campus housing is available for summer research interns. Rooms in the dormitory, adjacent to beautiful Woods Reservoir, can be reserved on a first-come, first-serve basis. Sharing of a room with a room-mate may be required. The cost of the dorm room is not included in the stipend for the internship and must be paid out-of-pocket by the intern. Pending COVID-19 developments, availability of rooms could be affected.

Application Requirements

Complete Online Application – Keyword 20000001FQ through the following site: https://ut.taleo.net/careersection/ut_system/jobsearch.ftl?lang=en

Attach Completed Addendum to Online Application. Before filling out this form, please save it to your computer to ensure that changes are kept. The addendum is available for download at the following site: https://www.utsi.edu/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/application_addendum_12-13-18_G-1.pdf
For best consideration, applications for the internship should be submitted by March 5, 2021. Applications received after this date will be reviewed if all slots have not been filled.

Applicants may be interviewed. Successful applicants will be notified by March 31, 2021.

INQUIRIES CAN BE MADE TO: UTSI Human Resources, Equity & Diversity, and Compliance, Email: hr@utsi.edu - Ph: 931-393-7226 - https://www.utsi.edu/utsi-summer-research-intern-program/

title: Undergrad intern - R&D (Global Field Medical Capabilities)
requirements:
Amgen’s 10 – 12 week internship program offers meaningful project experiences that impact patient’s lives. This internship provides the opportunity for executive and social networking events and to participate in community volunteer projects while providing a competitive compensation.

The Global Field Medical Capabilities Team is responsible for designing, aligning, and implementing initiatives that enhance the value proposition of the Field Medical organization. Critical for success is aligning global synergies while differentiating appropriate local solutions. We are responsible for driving and communicating quantitative and qualitative analytics of Field Medical performance.

The summer intern will have guidance and mentorship to develop a transformative analytics strategy to enhance and evolve our engagement with these key stakeholders. The intern will get exposure to the current mechanisms of how we engage medical opinion leaders [e.g. Medical Science Liaisons (MSLs), medical information, clinical research/publications, congresses/educational events, etc] and the relevant Amgen SOPs that govern these interactions. The intern will work with key internal partners. Experience obtained during this internship includes review and analysis of field documentation, TA specific publications, writing and communication skills to leadership teams, and learning how to apply critical analytic skills to support our business needs within the biopharmaceutical industry.

The specific project will be to review and analyze external engagement documentation in our system of record to identify trends and generate insights. Following this assessment, the intern will work with internal stakeholders to inform the use AI for future analyses. The final output will be a complete TA specific analytics report presented to medical and cross-functional leadership teams.

Basic Qualifications

Amgen requires that all individuals applying for an undergraduate internship or an undergraduate co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria

18 years or older

Currently enrolled in a full time Bachelor’s Degree program from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent

Completion of one year of study from an accredited college or university prior to the internship commencing

Enrolled in a full time Bachelor’s or Combined Bachelor's/Master's degree program following the potential internship or co-op assignment with an accredited college or university

Must not be employed at the time the internship starts

Preferred Qualifications

Degree concentration in Sciences

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Only candidates who apply via http //careers.amgen.com/ will be considered. Please search the Keyword section for 115369.

Join Us

If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.

Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.

As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

title: Research Intern, Building Energy
requirements:
Description & Requirements

PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners. We create new business options, accelerate time to market, augment internal capabilities, and reduce risk for our clients. Since its inception, PARC has pioneered many technology platforms – from the Ethernet and laser printing to the GUI and ubiquitous computing – and has enabled the creation of many industries. Incorporated as an independent, wholly owned subsidiary of Xerox in 2002, PARC today continues the research that enables breakthroughs for our clients' businesses

Palo Alto Research Center (PARC) is looking for an intern to work on the next generation of building energy modeling and controls. As part of the CleanTech initiative, we are looking at opportunities in building energy management to reduce energy consumption and carbon footprint while improving comfort for the occupants. The research is focused on enabling technologies that substantially speed up the use of scalable building energy models and the deployment of model predictive controls, estimation, and diagnostics.

The intern will be involved in the development of python-based software tools to support this research, specifically, on linking multiple simulation programs (Modelica, EnergyPlus, etc.) to create a testbed for rapid prototyping and verification of novel building modeling and control approaches. The responsibilities also include documenting and maintaining the code repository. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter and full of ideas to shape the next generation of building controls.

Scope/Responsibilities
Develop and deploy a co-simulation platform based on Modelica and FMI standards.
Assist in first principles (physics-based) and data-driven (grey-box) modeling of hygro-thermal dynamics
Develop and manage databases
Clean up, contribute and maintain the project repository
Assist in documentation of the project and contribute to conference and journal publications

Requirements
Working towards a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Physics or a related field
Expertise in EnergyPlus and Modelica
Excellent programming skills (language-independent!)
Basic knowledge of machine learning algorithms
Understanding hybrid modeling, controls, state estimation, and experience with embedded systems is a plus.

Xerox is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity or expression, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law. Additional Job Information:

In this role, you will contribute to the research and analytical efforts of the Energy, Environmental, and Climate Policy Analysis program at EPRI, specifically contributing to the global climate team. You will help support this work by researching and compiling quantitative and qualitative information on the potential economic costs of climate change and help apply that information to EPRI’s research to inform policy and company decision-making. title: Marketing Research Intern

At Cable One and our family of companies, we keep our customers and associates connected to what matters most. title: Summer Intern 2021 - Data Scientist
requirements:
Looking for an innovative, creative, passionate, and fun company in OC? Then, let us introduce ourselves. We are MobilityWare and we make fun for a living! Our mobile games have been rocking the app store since its inception and we regularly show up in top lists for most popular games. We recently reached over 350 million downloads across our portfolio of games!

We have been voted 2015, 2016, 2017 & 2018 Best Places to Work in Orange County by the Orange County Business Journal and OC Register! Headquartered in Irvine, CA., our flagship game, Solitaire, was released on the day the App Store opened in 2008. Other titles include Blackjack, FreeCell, Jigsaw Puzzle and Spider Solitaire, to name a few. Our mission is to bring JOY to others one game at a time.

Position Summary

As a Data Science Intern, you will support the product team with in depth analyses related to in-game activity, user behaviors, retention, funnel and monetization analysis, and provide insights to enhance the user experience. Your work will directly influence what features are built, prioritization of the roadmap and estimate expected return on these efforts.

You'll be helping the data science team to create, develop, deploy, monitor, present and maintain machine learning models, recommendation system, deep learning models and other models on real business data to support product efforts to drive user retention and in-game monetization. In addition to the product team, you will work closely with the DBAs, Marketing, and Monetization teams to create actionable insights.

Responsibilities
Perform single dimension preliminary data analysis using SQL query and python
Help the team to create, develop, deploy, monitor and maintain data science models for various business use cases
Help the team to extract valuable insights from model outputs and present visualization results to the leadership team
Work with our revenue and product teams to deliver insights into user acquisition, user engagement, user retention, user performance, and more
Work closely with the monetization team on continuous forecasting of various revenue models
Work with the data engineering team on data definition, ETL, data ingestion, data merge, data cleaning and trouble shoot issues for very large datasets


Qualifications For The Position
Enrolled in an advanced degree program (Master or PHD) and study in a quantitative field with Modeling/Data Science coursework
Proficiency in Python, SQL (Optional: C++/C#, Java, R/Matlab)
Experiences in several machine learning frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch and other alternatives
Experiences in developing machine learning algorithm from scratch
Able to read and understand average academia papers in machine learning research, or other areas such as computer vision research, AI Robotics, Natural language processing, or other related areas
SQL and familiarity with relational databases, MS SQL, data transformation, data mining, and ad hoc analysis
Skilled in analyzing data and drawing appropriate conclusions. Able to effectively translate statistical findings to business strategies that positively impact the business and customer.
Can work with Database and Statistical applications; can automate routine procedures and create tools that increase productivity and efficiency.
Ability to work productively with others in a highly collaborative manner
Minimum of a Bachelor's degree

Why you should work for us:
Casual workplace - yes, flip flops and shorts are pretty much an everyday thing
Growth, growth, growth - we are growing and we would love for you to join us on the ride
Awesome office smack dab in the middle of OC and 2 minutes off the 5 freeway
Amazing talent: We've got some heavy hitters from the industry who embody both brilliance AND humility

title: Intern - Medicinal Chemistry
requirements:
Who We Are

At Neurocrine Biosciences, we pride ourselves on having a strong, inclusive, and positive culture based on our shared purpose and values. We know what it takes to be great, and we are as passionate about our people as we are about our purpose - to relieve patient suffering and enhance lives.

What We Do

Neurocrine Biosciences is a neuroscience-focused, biopharmaceutical company with 28 years of experience discovering and developing life-changing treatments for people with serious, challenging and under-addressed neurological, endocrine and psychiatric disorders. The company's diverse portfolio includes FDA-approved treatments for tardive dyskinesia, Parkinson's disease, endometriosis* and uterine fibroids*, with three pivotal and five mid-stage clinical programs in multiple therapeutic areas. Headquartered in San Diego , Neurocrine Biosciences specializes in targeting and interrupting disease-causing mechanisms involving the interconnected pathways of the nervous and endocrine systems. (*in collaboration with AbbVie)

About the Role:

Neurocrine Biosciences, Inc. (NASDAQ: NBIX) is offering the opportunity to gain research experience in Medicinal Chemistry at our laboratories. Our intern program offers exposure to the chemistry behind our efforts at discovering new compounds and advancing them within our pipeline. This role offers the participant both theoretical principles about medicinal chemistry as well as important practical aspects such as automation.
_

Your Contributions (include, But Are Not Limited To)
Synthesizing novel chemical intermediates and final compounds:
Reviewing the chemical literature to obtain procedures, guide reaction sequences
Setting up, monitoring and working-up reactions
Purifying compounds by chromatography or recrystallization
Generating and interpreting biological data
Helping develop plans to address medicinal chemistry goals
Maintaining a complete laboratory notebook
Interacting with other chemists and pharmacologists within the company
Completing a special project and present the recommendations to senior management upon completion
Requirements:
Pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in a chemical or biological field
Practical experience with organic synthesis is highly desirable
Undergraduate courses in Organic Chemistry
Ability to work in a laboratory environment
Prior laboratory experience
Good verbal and written communication skills
Ability to think creatively and be a team player
Interest in attending various program events, including social gatherings, career development workshops, and more
Ability to commit to a 10 week, full-time summer program
Neurocrine Biosciences is an EEO/AA/Disability/Vets employer.

title: Bioethics Intern - Limited Tenure
requirements:
Position description

The primary purpose of the Undergraduate Bioethics Internship is to provide an intern with the opportunity to work on a particular research project for the summer under the direction of a faculty mentor. Students will participate in a biomedical ethics summer curriculum, which includes educational sessions on bioethics research methods and lunch meetings with members of the program faculty. The intern is responsible for observing the functions and processes of the assigned work unit. In addition, the intern may be given selected work assignments to reinforce the learning experience, to assess the performance levels and to provide benefit to the work unit. The intern will be responsible for completing all internship-related assignments and reports for both Mayo and the participating educational facility. The duration and timing of the internship will be arranged with the intern and the sponsoring educational facility.

Candidates must attach the following documents to the online application:
Cover letter describing your career goals and how biomedical ethics research relates to those goals
Resume/CV that includes your major, relevant coursework, honors, and related experiences
A 5-10 page writing sample (such as a course paper), preferably on a topic in biomedical ethics
Current college transcript (unofficial copy is acceptable)
Two letters of recommendation from research mentors or undergraduate professors should be emailed to bioethics@mayo.edu
Letters should be addressed to Dr. Richard Sharp, Director, Biomedical Ethics Research Program.

Top applicants will be invited to participate in a brief phone interview to discuss specific skills and areas of research interest.

The application deadline for this position is April 9, 2021.

Qualifications

The incumbent must be enrolled in a degree program from a college or university. Typically, this internship would occur after the student has taken most of the courses required by the degree program. Where applicable - the degree program must require an internship as a graduation requirement (or offer as a credit option).

Authorization to work and remain in the United States, without necessity for Mayo Clinic sponsorship now, or in the future (for example, be a U.S. citizen, national, or permanent resident, refugee or asylee)

This position has an anticipated end date of 8/6/2021.

Candidates must attach the following documents to the online application:
Cover letter describing your career goals and how biomedical ethics research relates to those goals
Resume/CV that includes your major, relevant coursework, honors, and related experiences
A 5-10 page writing sample (such as a course paper), preferably on a topic in biomedical ethics
Current college transcript (unofficial copy is acceptable)
Additional Qualifications

Successful applicants will be:
committed to pursuing a career in which they will engage topics in biomedical ethics
able to work independently
proficient in written and verbal communication
highly motivated to learn new research methods
Site description

Mayo Clinic is located in the heart of downtown Rochester, Minnesota, a vibrant, friendly city that provides a highly livable environment for more than 34,000 Mayo staff and students. The city is consistently ranked among the best places to live in the United States because of its affordable cost of living, healthy lifestyle, excellent school systems and exceptionally high quality of life.

Compensation Detail

This position has a predetermined rate of $13.00 per hour.

Equal opportunity employer

As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Mayo Clinic is committed to creating an inclusive environment that values the diversity of its employees and does not discriminate against any employee or candidate. Women, minorities, veterans, people from the LGBTQ communities and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply to join our teams. Reasonable accommodations to access job openings or to apply for a job are available.

title: Behavioral Science Intern, Well Living Lab
requirements:
The Well Living Lab (WLL) is looking for a Research intern (up to 5 months) to perform innovative research studies to understand how features of the indoor environment affect human health and well-being. This position leverages the unique opportunity and collaboration between Delos and Mayo Clinic upon which the lab is built. This person will work closely with the Well Living Lab Research Team, Well Living Lab Technology Team members, and the rest of the Well Living Lab team to conduct multidisciplinary research at the lab. In this position, you will have the opportunity to work with our cutting-edge technology in the lab to conduct our ongoing research relating physiological measures, behavioral measures, cognitive performance, and other health-related outcomes to environmental features of the indoor environment.

Responsibilities:

Work collaboratively with the WLL Research Team to conduct human subjects research studies to understand how the features of the indoor environment affects cognition, stress, and other measures of emotional wellbeing and behavior
Work closely with the WLL Research Team to analyze data collected from these behavioral studies, including analyzing physiological measures from wearable devices (e.g., smart watches), analyze performance on different cognitive assessments, perform statistical analyses on
Work with our Technology team to develop and support the technologies that meet the requirements and specifications of current and future WLL research projects
Assist in writing publications to submit to peer-reviewed journals in relation to indoor environment and health

Prerequisite Qualifications:

College undergraduate Juniors or above; Bachelor's degree or above, in one or more of the following fields:
Biology
Neuroscience
Cognitive Neuroscience
Biomedical Engineering
Health/Health Studies
Psychology
Behavioral Science
Any other related degree
Programming experience in Java, C, C#, Python, MATLAB or other similar programming languages
Experience conducting human subject research
Ability to thrive in self-managed and team-based work
Enthusiasm to learn, use, and develop innovative research skills, technologies, and tools
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and effective time management skills

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working with an IRB to manage human subject research
Prior experience writing academic manuscripts or conference abstracts
Experience analyzing physiological time series data (e.g., heart rate or heart rate variability from smart watches or electroencephalography (EEG) from portable devices)
Experience delivering and analyzing performance of cognitive assessments such as working memory, inhibition, task-switching, etc.
Experience working in a research and multidisciplinary team setting
Creativity - there's always a way; sometimes we just haven't found it yet.

Applicants are selected based upon their qualifications for this position and without regard to the applicant's race, color, ethnic or national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, marital or partnership status, citizenship or alienage status, veteran status, whether children are, may be or would be residing with a person, or any other characteristic protected by law.

About the Well Living Lab:

The Well Living Lab, a Delos and Mayo Clinic collaboration, was created to research the real-world impact of indoor environments on human health and well-being and generate evidence-based information that can be used in practical ways to create healthier indoor spaces. For more information about the Lab, visit www.welllivinglab.com.

About Delos:

As the pioneer of Wellness Real Estate™ and founder of the WELL Building Standard®, Delos is transforming our homes, offices, schools, and other indoor environments by placing health and wellness at the center of design and construction decisions. The Delos platform includes research, consulting, merchandising, and programming and licensing innovative solutions for the built environment, creating spaces that nurture and promote human health and wellbeing.

Exploring the intersection between humans and the built environment, Delos creates spaces that actively contribute to human health, performance and wellbeing by marrying the best innovations in technology, health, science, design, and enterprise. We see the built-environment as an asset to maximize human-potential and envision environments that enhance us. Environments that are proactive, enabling us to live better by cultivating better lifestyle choices and by solving health problems before they are created. We have broadened the scope of environmental sustainability, extending the concept beyond the best of green technology to an integrated solution that addresses human sustainability.

Our mission is to build a better world. Join us.

For additional information, please visit us at www.delos.com

title: Market Research Intern - Graduate Student
requirements:
About GM

There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Why Work for Us

Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States.

Spring/Summer 2021 Internship

The Market Research Intern will report to a leader in Global Market Research, a part of GM’s Global Portfolio Planning Staff. The mission of Global Market Research is to help our internal clients gain a deep understanding of the customer needs and desires, the societal and technology trends, and the marketplace forces crafting the future of mobility, to build exciting and innovative vehicles and services, and effectively market them around the globe.

Our culture is to pursue facts, respectfully challenge assumptions, and clearly define objectives. In this internship, you will experience the satisfaction of applying multiple research methodologies to inform real-world decisions and of seeing a market research project through – from start to finish! Working with the Market Research Manager, you will assist in the project framing, questionnaire and sample frame development, logistics and planning, study execution, data analysis, report writing and presentation of findings – including to Executive Leadership.

Qualifications

Additional Job Description
Currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Market Research or related field
GPA 3.5 or higher out of 4.0
Able to work fulltime, 40 hours per week
Demonstrates leadership in field of study, extra-curricular activities or service organizations

Desired Skills
Outstanding interpersonal and relationship management skills to effectively collaborate with varying levels of the organization as needed
Basic knowledge of Marketing Research
Strong leadership skills, to guide project teams through planning, execution and insight phases
Strong critical thinking and analytical skills to synthesize large amounts of data involving multiple variables into comprehensive, impactful insights
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, managing results and goals
Willingness to ask questions, take initiative and be resourceful and inventive
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to distill sophisticated subjects to a wider audience
Emerging partnership and collaboration skills and ability to learn from and share knowledge with co-workers in a rapidly moving environment
High level of integrity, ability to deal with ambiguity, takes initiative/self-directed
Evidence of strong character with integrity, honesty, accountability and trust
Deliver new and creative solutions to sophisticated problems

PLEASE ONLY APPLY IF YOU DO NOT NEED SPONSORSHIP TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. WE ARE UNABLE TO CONSIDER CANDIDATES WHO REQUIRE SPONSORSHIP.

This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within the United States.

The median level of the monthly salary compensation for this role is $4500 dependent upon class status and degree. Benefit options are not available for this role.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.
